medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasing lethargy, confusion, and abnormalities on brain imaging.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 2 months prior to admission with increasing apathy and lethargy, followed by social withdrawal, episodes of confusion, and visual and tactile hallucinations. The patient slept most of the time and required assistance with daily activities. Three weeks before admission, she experienced sadness and lack of motivation after seeing her primary care physician.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Connective-tissue disease diagnosed 7 years ago, idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura diagnosed 5 years ago, history of bilateral subdural hematomas and subarachnoid hemorrhages 4 years ago, and a history of polymyalgia rheumatica, arthritis, congenital sixth cranial nerve palsy, migraine headaches, multinodular goiter, dry eyes, gastroesophageal reflux disease, Helicobacter pylori infection, hypertension, hyperglycemia, and hyperlipidemia.
medical_history.family_history: Father had depression and died in his 90s; mother died from bladder and kidney cancer at age 85; an aunt had systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
medical_history.social_history: Patient lives with her husband, retired from office work, and cared for her elderly father until his death the previous year. She does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
